含义: The character '并' (bìng) primarily means 'and', 'moreover', 'also', or 'to combine'. It is often used to indicate the joining or combining of two or more things, ideas, or actions.
字形: The character '并' consists of two parts: the left part is a simplified form of '立' (lì), meaning 'to stand', and the right part is '开' (kāi), meaning 'to open'. Together, they symbolize the idea of standing together or combining.
读音: The pronunciation of '并' is 'bìng' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '并' originated from ancient Chinese pictographs. It originally depicted two people standing side by side, symbolizing unity or combination. Over time, its form evolved into the modern character we use today.
常用词组: 并列 (bìng liè) - to place side by side, to rank equally
合并 (hé bìng) - to merge, to combine
并排 (bìng pái) - side by side
成语: 并行不悖 (bìng xíng bù bèi) - to run parallel without conflict
并驾齐驱 (bìng jià qí qū) - to go forward together, to keep pace with
并日而食 (bìng rì ér shí) - to eat only once in two days, to live in extreme poverty
例句: 他不仅聪明，并且非常勤奋。 (Tā bù jǐn cōngmíng, bìngqiě fēicháng qínfèn.) - He is not only smart but also very diligent.
这两家公司已经合并了。 (Zhè liǎng jiā gōngsī yǐjīng hébìng le.) - These two companies have already merged.
短故事: 在古代，有两个村庄因为水源问题经常发生冲突。后来，一位智者建议他们合并成一个村庄，共享资源。从此，两个村庄和平共处，共同繁荣。
在《三国演义》中，刘备和孙权并力抗曹，最终在赤壁之战中取得了胜利。
